Access a complete list of filterable artifacts logged across all your models in the {{< var validmind.platform >}}, or look at only artifacts linked to a specific model.

::: {.callout}
Within the {{< var validmind.platform >}}, artifacts are split into:[^1]

- Validation issues
- Other artifact types
:::

::: {.attn}

## Prerequisites

- [x] {{< var link.login >}}
- [x] There are models registered in the model inventory.[^2]
- [x] There are artifacts logged on any model.[^3]
- [x] You are a [{{< fa circle-check >}} Validator]{.bubble} or assigned another role with sufficient permissions to perform the tasks in this guide.[^4]

:::

## View artifacts

You can view artifacts for all models at once, or only view artifacts linked to a specific model.

### View all artifacts

{{< include _view-all-artifacts.qmd >}}

### View model-specific artifacts

1. In the left sidebar, click **{{< fa cubes >}} Inventory**.

2. Select a model or find your model by applying a filter or searching for it.[^5]

3. View validation issues or other artifact types for that model.

::: {.panel-tabset}

#### View model-specific validation issues

a. In the left sidebar that appears for your model, click **{{< fa triangle-exclamation >}} Validation Issues**.

b. Click on any validation issue for more information, including the proposed remediation plan and any supporting attachments.[^6]

   Attachments are listed with the following information:

   - Filename
   - Icon representing file type
   - Date uploaded
   - The user who uploaded the file
   - File size
   - Notes

   Click on the attachment to view or download the file.

#### View model-specific artifacts of other types

a. In the left sidebar that appears for your model, click **{{< fa border-all >}} Artifacts**.

b. Select an artifact type[^7] to view from the tabs:

   - Policy Exception
   - Model Limitation

   In the page that opens is a list of all artifacts for that type.

c. Click on any artifact for more information.

:::


## Filter and sort artifacts

:::{.callout}
Changes are automatically saved to your account and do not affect other users.
:::

- By default, artifacts for all models are listed by creation date in descending order.
- To sort artifacts by a column in ascending ({{< fa angle-down >}}) or descending ({{< fa angle-up >}}) order, click on the column header.

To narrow down artifacts, you can apply some filters:

::: {.panel-tabset}

### Filter all validation issues

1. In the left sidebar, click **{{< fa triangle-exclamation >}} Validation Issues** to view a list of validation issues across all models.

2. Click **{{< fa filter >}} Filter**.

3. On the Select Your Filters dialog that opens, enter your filtering criteria.[^8]

4. Click **Apply Filters**.

### Filter all other artifacts

1. In the left sidebar, click **{{< fa triangle-exclamation >}} Validation Issues** to view lists of other artifact types across all models.

2. Select an artifact type[^9] to view from the tabs:

   - Policy Exception
   - Model Limitation

3. Click **{{< fa filter >}} Filter**.

4. On the Select Your Filters dialog that opens, enter your filtering criteria.[^10]

5. Click **Apply Filters**.

:::
